title: Not a 3-and-3-halves-opt
description: I'm going to share YET ANOTHER simple but working tsp solutions optimization technique. The idea is straightforward: if you have THREE cities in the path that are 'close' (in distance terms) to each other you can try to split the path by them and try different permutations of resulting chunks hoping that the decrease of the total penalty in this part of the path will be greater than the increase of the length caused by the permutation itself. Also instead of just permutating the chunks of the path you can  try to revert the order of some chunks but I won't do it in this kernel.
